intro: Sida callifera, commonly known as the silky sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in areas with high humidity. Sida callifera is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
